formattedAddress: 225 W 70th St a, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 225 W 70th St a, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text: Dan has a calm and honest approach to therapy. I appreciate his realistic advice. He very often validates my feelings and gives me tools on how to cope with certain situations. He also shows me some tough love when I need it, and again, shares ideas on how to work through the issues. I always leave our sessions feeling like I have made progress. I highly recommend Dan to anyone seeking therapy.

I highly recommend Dan to anyone seeking therapy.

originalText.text: Dan was always there when I needed to talk and he never missed an appointment. He is direct, honest, and a good listener, all of which helped me immensely. He is reliable and flexible, able to easily accommodate your schedule. I had to stop seeing Dan because I moved cities, but I would continue to see him regularly if I were able.

He is reliable and flexible, able to easily accommodate your schedule. I had to stop seeing Dan because I moved cities, but I would continue to see him regularly if I were able.

originalText.text:
Dan is kind and calm and patient, qualities that make him a great therapist. Therapy can be really hard, but he tries to make it/me as relaxed as possible. Dan listens if I want to talk, but is also OK talking or just sitting quietly.

I've been to a few doctors/therapists, many of whom were hard to talk to or otherwise insufferable. So finding Dan was kind of amazing.

text.text:

originalText.text:
That "One-in-a-Million" Therapist
Ok, I haven't met a million therapists, but over a long adult life, I have worked with a few. Dan stands out for keen insight, full engagement (I've never seen him come close to a yawn), forthrightness and compassion. Dan connects. The room feels live. After our 3-year individual and/or group therapies ended, I contacted Dan over a year later when a life-altering challenge arose. That worked out great too. HIGHLY RECOMMEND

That "One-in-a-Million" Therapist

originalText.text:
I have been seeing Dan for a number of years, because he keeps helping me to meet new challenges. He is easy to talk with, trustworthy and has helped me to get to answers on my own - not given them to me. Plus, he is a real person. Spending time unravelling a problem with him is not sitting across from a therapist-bot. His office has been a safe place for me to unload and then re-evaluate my fears.  I've been able to make game plans for difficult situations, instead of avoiding them.
My life feels like it has more options now, and Dan's encouragement (and prodding :) has been integral to that process.
